name: mistune
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to change a part of a musical instrument in order to make it play particular sounds, but not in the correct or usual way: The piano had been mistuned, so the first half of the concert was a disaster. The (deliberately) mistuned violin added an interesting expressiveness. Related word
tune verb (INSTRUMENT)
If a radio, television, etc., is mistuned, it does not receive programmes clearly from a particular station. : The static from a mis-tuned radio has a fairly constant loudness. Related word
tune verb (RADIO)
More examplesFewer examplesThe lights obscured her face as she played her mistuned guitar. There were very few dropped notes or mistuned chords.As I struggled up the hill, my lungs whined like a mistuned banjo.
